name: lmodabl

stmt.origin: isabld(hs0, hs1, c0, cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0), wcel(c0, clmod))
stmt.pretty: isabld(hs0, hs1, c0, (Base ` c0), (+ ` c0), c0 ∈ LMod)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cabl))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cbs, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cgrp))
-| wi(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0))), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cplusg, c0), cv(hs0))))
-| diffss(hs0, hs1)
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsc(hs0, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| diffsc(hs1, c0)
-| diffsc(hs1, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(c0, clmod))
-| diffsw(hs1, wcel(c0, clmod))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Abel)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod →(Base ` c0)=(Base ` c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod →(+ ` c0)=(+ ` c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Grp)
⊣ ((c0 ∈ LMod ∧ hs0 ∈(Base ` c0)∧ hs1 ∈(Base ` c0))→(hs0[(+ ` c0)]hs1)=(hs1[(+ ` c0)]hs0))
⊣ d(hs0, hs1)
⊣ d(hs0, c0)
⊣ d(hs0,(Base ` c0))
⊣ d(hs1, c0)
⊣ d(hs1,(Base ` c0))
⊣ d(hs0, c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ d(hs1, c0 ∈ LMod)

comment: A left module is an abelian group (of vectors, under addition). (Contributed by NM, 8-Dec-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2014.)
